melting.sequences
Class BasePair

java.lang.Object
  melting.sequences.BasePair

public class BasePair
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a base pair of nucleic acids. The instance variables are : int position : the position of the base pair in the sequence. String topAcid : the nucleic acid from the sequence (5'3'). String bottomAcid : the nucleic acid from the complementary sequence (3'5'). private static ArrayList existingNucleicAcids : the list registering all the possible nucleic acids known by MELTING.

Constructor Detail

BasePair

public BasePair(int pos)
To create a BasePair, we need to give the position in the sequence where starts the String TopAcid or BottomAcid.

Parameters:
int - pos : the position of the base pair in the sequence. It is the starting position of the String TopAcid or BottomAcid in the String sequence.
Method Detail

getTopAcid

public java.lang.String getTopAcid()
This method is called to get the nucleic acid "TopAcid" of BasePair.

Returns:
String TopAcid : The nucleic acid "TopAcid" of BasePair.. It represents the nucleic acid from the sequence (5'3').

setTopAcid

public void setTopAcid(java.lang.String topAcid)
To change the TopAcid Value of BasePair..

getBottomAcid

public java.lang.String getBottomAcid()
This method is called to get the nucleic acid "BottomAcid" of BasePair..

Returns:
String TopAcid : The nucleic acid "BottomAcid" of BasePair. It represents the nucleic acid from the complementary sequence (3'5').

setBottomAcid

public void setBottomAcid(java.lang.String bottomAcid)
To change the BottomAcid Value of BasePair.

isComplementaryBasePair

public boolean isComplementaryBasePair()
To check if the two nucleic acids in the base pair are complementary.

Returns:
true if the TopAcid and BottomAcid are complementary. There is complementarity if the two acids (TopAcid, BottomAcid) of the base pair are (A,T), (T,A), (A,U), (U,A), (C,G) or (G,C).

isFrequentNucleicAcidTopBase

public boolean isFrequentNucleicAcidTopBase()
Check if the Nucleic acid TopAcid is a frequent nucleic acid.

Returns:
true if the TopAcid of BasePair is a frequent nucleic acid. A frequent nucleic acid is A, T, U, G or C.

isWatsonCrickBottomBase

public boolean isWatsonCrickBottomBase()
Check if the Nucleic acid BottomAcid is a frequent nucleic acid.

Returns:
true if the BottomAcid of BasePair is a frequent nucleic acid. A frequent nucleic acid is A, T, U, G or C.

isTopBasePyrimidine

public boolean isTopBasePyrimidine()
Check if the nucleic acid represented by TopAcid is a pyrimidine.

Returns:
true if the TopAcid of BasePair is a pyrimidine. C, T and U are pyrimidines.

isBottomBasePyrimidine

public boolean isBottomBasePyrimidine()
Check if the nucleic acid represented by BottomAcid is a pyrimidine.

Returns:
true if the BottomAcid of BasePair is a pyrimidine. C, T and U are pyrimidines.

isBasePairEqualTo

public boolean isBasePairEqualTo(java.lang.String base1,
                                 java.lang.String base2)
Check if the two nucleic acids of the base pair are (base1, base2) or (base2, base1).

Parameters:
String - base1 : first base (the nucleic acid is represented by a String)
String - base2 : second base (the nucleic acid is represented by a String)
Returns:
true if (TopAcid, BottomAcid) is equal to (base1, base2) or (base2, base1).

isBasePairStrictlyEqualTo

public boolean isBasePairStrictlyEqualTo(java.lang.String base1,
                                         java.lang.String base2)
Check if the two nucleic acids of the base pair are (base1, base2).

Parameters:
String - base1 : first base (the nucleic acid is represented by a String)
String - base2 : second base (the nucleic acid is represented by a String)
Returns:
true if (TopAcid, BottomAcid) is strictly equal to (base1, base2).

getLengthAcid

public int getLengthAcid()
This method is called to get the length of the nucleic acid.

Returns:
int length : The maximum length between the TopAcid length and the BottomAcid length.

isUnpaired

public boolean isUnpaired()
To check if the nucleic acids in the base pair are paired.

Returns:
true if the nucleic acids in the base pair are paired. When a nucleic acid is unpaired, there is a gap in the duplex represented by "-". Consequently, the nucleic acids are paired in BasePair if TopAcid and bottomAcid are not equal to "-".

initialiseNucleicAcidList

public static void initialiseNucleicAcidList()
initialises the existingNucleicAcids of BasePair.

getExistingNucleicAcids

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getExistingNucleicAcids()
This method is called to get the existingNucleicAcids of BasePair.

Returns:
ArrayList existingNucleicAcids of BasePair.

getPosition

public int getPosition()
This method is called to get the position of BasePair in the duplex.

Returns:
int position of the BasePair object.
